Articles.Content:
the crash folder:https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B5iz6AkddSYEclhhVlZ3NF9qSVU&usp=sharing

I have lll,lll extra, mechjeb2,x science,blizy's toolbar, boulderCo,burntogether,chatterer,crewmanifest,darkmultiplayer,

kerbalengineer,firespitter,jsi,kas,kerbalfoundries,kerbaltek,kerbpaint,

klockheed_martin,kronalutils,ksa,kso,kspavc,ksplua,kwrocketry,

Infernalrobotics,mk2decoupler,modrocketsys,mp_nazari,nasamission,

navhud,nebula,nereid,nyancat,partcatalog,persistant trails,proceduralfairings,romfarer,smokescreen,squad,texturereplacer,thunderaerospace,trajectories,triggertech,tweakscale,vng, and that's about it.

I installed all the mods, exept the stuff in ksos. then I ran the game. it works really fast. I install ksos. the game crashes. I uninstall ksos. it works fine.

attempted on a clean install, still doesn't work.

Edited November 29, 2014 by jake9039

Judging by your mods, it looks like you're in excess of memory limits. KSOS is probably the "heaviest" mod out there, and it's not recommended to run it with other memory-demanding mods like LLL or KW. You should install ATM and\or run KSP in OpenGL mode.

You may be running out of memory but the log doesn't indicate this in the usual way. It appears that the game is crashing when applying a KSO ModuleManager patch. You actually have 3 different versions of ModuleManager installed and it appears to be running an old version from inside the KerbPaint folder rather than using version 2.5.1 from the main GameData folder. I suggest you delete the ModuleManager from GameData\KerbPaint\Plugins\ and also delete version 2.3.3 from the main GameData folder.

You also appear to have TweakScale related plugins in more than one place. There are several plugins in the TweakScale folder and also one in GameData\MagicSmokeIndustries\Plugins\ though I don't know if this would cause any issue. There is also a message saying that FireSpitter is incompatible so it may be worth checking if this is expected or if there is an update available.
I installed a mod for memory, and cut down on the stuff, so it works now
